Node.definition: = title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to pledge|to promise|to put up security
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities take responsibility for someone else, taking upon themselves that person's obligations or vouching for that person's security
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance

= causative action by which someone strikes the palm of their hand against someone else's palm; ► in order to show that one has taken responsibility for someone else's debts; ≈ usually regarded as unwise
= a person considered as not belonging to a certain group, be it religious, ethnic, or social
exact meaning unsure, possibly: = to strike the palm of one's hand against the hand of someone else usually a creditor to indicate that one has accepted the responsibility for another person's debt
= causative action by which someone tries to gain control over someone else in an unjust way, ◄ as if that person were an animal caught in a net or trap
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= particle linking two propositions, by which Y represents the purpose or result of X
= title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child
= action by which humans remove themselves from a dangerous or life threatening situation

literally: palm of the hand, with the focus on one of the activities that are performed with the hands: to hold someone against that person's will; = condition of being under the malevolent control of another person or group
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= state in which humans are sleeping relatively lightly; ≈ sometimes associated with being inactive
literally: eyelids; hence: = a poetic reference to the eye (עַיִן)
= action by which humans remove themselves from a dangerous or life threatening situation

= small to medium sized plain antelope, inhabiting savannah plains and semideserts, reddish brown in color with almost white underparts, and small horns (with exception of female impala); long legged, graceful, and an expert jumper; lives in small herds; the female is sexually active at one year; high rate of reproduction; ◄ |iGazella dorcas|i* or |iGazella arabica|i*; ► clean and can therefore be eaten; ≈ associated with speed, grace, beauty, female sexuality, male virility, and fertility
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
= generic term for a small bird; ► usually clean and can therefore be eaten
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
= someone who has made it his profession to catch animals and birds with the help of nets and traps; ≈ associated with aggression and oppression
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= small dark brown insect; its underground nest holds a queen ant, workers, and soldier ants that protect the nest; ant is capable of carrying many times its own weight; ◄ Messor semirufus or Harvester ant; ► symbol of diligence, hard work, and wisdom

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior that is part of what defines the nature of humans and animals, ◄ understood as a journey through life

Node.gloss: to be able|to be skillful|to be wise|to be intelligent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans, deities, and animals possess or gain a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= a person who is acknowledged by a group as having authority over them ► to provide leadership, often in battle, and justice
= person selected from among a group of people to assume a position of leadership and responsibility
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an object to be firmly located in a certain place

= hot season of the year, opposite of חֹרֶף (חֹרֶף) ► time when most crops are harvested and preparations are made for the cold season; ≈ sometimes associated with excessive heat and drought, and also with hard work
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= to gather in one's crops
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

= reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

= reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive
= state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive
= relatively low frequency of events or short duration of an event
= state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive
= relatively low frequency of events or short duration of an event
= state in which humans are sleeping relatively lightly; ≈ sometimes associated with being inactive
= relatively low frequency of events or short duration of an event
= action by which humans fold their hands together, ► probably in order to rest or take a nap; ≈ associated with being idle and laziness

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security
= person who spends much time on the road, either as well intentioned traveller or as roaming vagabond
= state in which humans lack sufficient means to live at a standard that is considered normal; ≈ sometimes associated with laziness or foolishness, but ultimately determined by God

= a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver; ≈ associated with protection and therefore often used as an epithet for God
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

possible literal meaning: without benefit or without success; hence: = state in which someone is considered an objectional human being who is engaged in evil behavior and does not contribute to the society in a positive way
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
literally: crookedness (of an event); hence: = state in which an event is considered morally and/or ethically unacceptable
= an action by which humans and deities utter words, ◄ as coming from their mouths
= causative action by which humans close and open one eye quickly, ≈ which is associated with gloating and evil intent

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and by extension of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire knowledge, a skill, or a certain type of behavior
= one of the five long and slender projections of the human hand; ► used for writing, pointing, grasping, and other activities; ≈ sometimes used metonymically to represent the entire body
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which someone exercises his mind (לֵב) in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose; ≈ mostly associated with evil purposes
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
literally: at all time; = a long stretch of time, without any interruptions
= state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons

Node.gloss: to send|to cause to happen|to stir up
Node.definition: literally: to send; hence: = causative action by which deities cause an event to happen
= extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death
= a very short interval of time

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= state in which a countable entity is six in number
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which a countable entity is seven in number
= state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
literally: (one's) eyes are high; hence: = state in which humans consider themselves greater than justified which becomes visible by the way they look around them
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
literally: to pour out blood; hence: = to wound or kill an animate being
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
= state in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which someone exercises his mind (לֵב) in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose; ≈ mostly associated with evil purposes
= procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet
= action by which humans or deities act without delay
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= state in which something that has been said is not truthful
= a person or deity who has evidence that something has taken place or that some decision has been made
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue

Node.gloss: to send|to cause to happen|to stir up
Node.definition: literally: to send; hence: = causative action by which deities cause an event to happen
= state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons
= a relationship linking two or more individuals or groups
= son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not
= title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
= causative action by which humans attach objects to other objects with a rope
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= the front part of the neck, ► around which ornaments can be placed; ≈ only used in wisdom literature
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move through an area without a specific destination

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= action by which humans utter words with the focus on what is said

= small container ◄ made out of earthenware, ► filled with oil (שֶׁמֶן) and with a wick (פִּשְׁתָּה) placed in it; sometimes placed on a lampstand (מְנֹורָה) used as a source of light (אֹור) ≈ associated with peace, stability and well being
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= action by which someone speaks in order to defend oneself or to accuse someone else; sometimes accompanied by actions

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= condition of a human or a spirit that is not considered morally good or pure or right; can refer to an individual, a group, or a nation
literally: smoothness of tongue; hence: = act of speaking words that have the appearance of being well intentioned but are actually being insincere
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
literally: foreign woman; = a woman who is the wife of someone else
= process by which humans or deities experience an eager desire for a person or object
= state in which the outward appearance of humans or objects is pleasing to the eye
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= the folds of skin ► that cover the eye when closed
= relation denoting that someone performs a certain event for the benefit of someone or something else, but with the implicit intention to reap a benefit as well
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= woman that sells her body for payment, making of this her profession; ≈ often associated with shame and sinful behavior
particle marking a phrase indicating a certain quantity; = marker emphasizing that the quantity expressed will not be exceeded
= a quantity of bread that is baked as one piece
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
literally: precious; hence: = state in which humans are considered valuable and worthy of respect

= causative action by which humans or animals make an effort to capture or kill (other) animals, sometimes with the help of devices such as weapons and traps; ► usually with the intention of killing and eating them; ≈ implies using stealth to locate and pursue the quarry, often used metaphorically to refer acts of aggression towards people or events to get other people in one's power
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= causative action by which humans take small objects from a particular location with an object shaped like a shovel ► in order to transfer them to another location

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

= front of the body of a human being, which, when a person is sitting down, forms a kind of platform that can be used for activities like throwing the lot, and that can even function as a sitting place for someone else, like a pet animal, a child or a beloved one; ≈ symbolizes affection and intimacy, and sometimes represents the entire person
= generic designation for any article of clothing

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move through an area without a specific destination
= carbonized material resulting from heating wood, ► and used for cooking or warming

= the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and by extension of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= process by the human body is affected by fire
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance

Node.gloss: to be free|to be innocent|to go unpunished
Node.definition: = state or process in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments

Node.gloss: to touch (a woman) > to have sex
Node.definition: literally: to touch (a woman); hence: = action by which a man has sexual relations with a woman, either or not consensually
= state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions
= human who secretly takes possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it

= action by which humans secretly take possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even of other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it
literally: to fill; hence: = action by which humans do what is needed to find relief from their desire

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= to be in a state of wanting or needing food, but having little to no access to food
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for
= state in which an event is to be repeated seven times

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= action by which married humans have voluntary sexual intercourse with other humans who are not their spouse; ≈ often used as a metaphor for treachery or idolatry
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= state in which humans lack a particular quality that they are supposed to have
literally: heart; hence: = the ability to think for oneself as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= a disease or sickness or wound ◄ caused by another person or sent from God or a deity ► to punish a person or nation for some wrong or disobedience
= state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition
literally: to find (a certain condition); hence: = process by which humans eventually reach a certain state or condition
= state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people
= causative action by which deities or humans ensure that (other) humans and/or their actions will no longer be remembered

= process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger with regard to someone else, ◄ because that other person has qualities, privileges, or possessions that one feels one should have as well, or because that person lavishes favors on another party that one feels should be directed to oneself
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
= a male human

Node.gloss: to be concerned for|to have pity on|to show mercy|to spare
Node.definition: = process by which humans or deities experience an emotion of affection for a particular object or state of event; ► resulting in unwillingness to see that object come to harm or that event to be obstructed

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

Node.gloss: to respect|to look upon or treat with favor|to honor
Node.definition: literally: to lift up (someone's) face; hence: = action by which humans or deities show favor or respect to someone, ◄ as if by allowing someone who is looking down out of shame or humility to look up directly into one's face
= a sum of money demanded or paid, either legally or illegally, in exchange for a service, or in exchange for someone's freedom or someone's life
= state in which someone is favorably disposed towards an event
= an object, usually of some value, given to a person; ► can be given without any expectation of exchange or often with the purpose to influence or persuade another person
